Right now the `Joint::Pose()` function returns the value in

    
    <joint>
       <pose>x y z R P Y</pose>
    </joint>

The `Joint::PoseFrame` function returns the frame name, for example “parent” in the following:

    
    <joint>
        <pose frame="parent">x y z R P Y</pose>
    </joint>

There is value to `Joint::Pose` returning the raw pose value, independent of the frame name.
